intro: Stranvaesia salicifolia, commonly known as the willow-leaf stranvaesia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to South Africa, specifically the Western Cape Province, where it grows in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its slender, willow-like leaves that are lanceolate and often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Stranvaesia salicifolia is a perennial herb that thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in fynbos vegetation.
